column1: Adobe Flash (formerly Macromedia Flash) is a rich internet application distributed by Adobe Systems. Adobe Flash and Adobe Flash Player are used to create and view animated content that can be placed on web pages. Adobe Flash is used commonly on the Internet by web browsers.Flash was created by FutureWave (a multimedia company) in 1995. Then it was called "FutureSplash Animator" (this was in fact Flash 1.0). FutureWave along with Flash were soon bought by Macromedia around 1997
column2: who in December 2005 was again bought by Adobe Systems. From Flash version 2 to 8 it was called "Macromedia Flash"
column3: now it is called "Adobe Flash". In 2012
column4: Adobe discontinued the Solaris version of Flash Player
column5: and made the Linux version only for Google Chrome. The Linux version for Firefox will continue to receive security updates. The Android version was removed from Google Play
column6: but it can still be downloaded from the Adobe website. The Android version is not officially supported on Android beyond 4.0
column7: but it has been reported to work with versions 4.1 and 4.2.
